intro: Erigeron huachucanus, commonly known as the Huachuca blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron huachucanus is often found in desert scrub and woodland habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
